feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition RCE Vulnerability
entry.content:
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with privileges to manipulate layouts and images can insert a malicious payload into the page layout.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8150
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051105/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p783-gj6m-9r88

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition RCE Vulnerability
entry.content:
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with privileges to manipulate layouts and images can insert a malicious payload into the page layout.

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition SSRF vulnerability
entry.content:
A server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with admin privileges to modify store configurations can manipulate the connector api endpoint to enable remote code execution.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8156
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051105/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-775w-gx3f-4j4f

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition SSRF vulnerability
entry.content:
A server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with admin privileges to modify store configurations can manipulate the connector api endpoint to enable remote code execution.

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
in Magento prior to 1.9.4.3 and Magento prior to 1.14.4.3, an authenticated user with limited administrative privileges can inject arbitrary JavaScript code into transactional email page when creating a new email template or editing existing email template.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8228
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211209030216/https://magento.com/security/patches/supee-11219
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-988g-wfwf-5666

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition RCE Vulnerability
entry.content:
In Magento prior to 1.9.4.3, and Magento prior to 1.14.4.3, an authenticated user with administrative privileges to edit product attributes can execute arbitrary code through crafted layout updates.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8229
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211209030216/https://magento.com/security/patches/supee-11219
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w8vh-5v64-j3vr

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
In Magento prior to 1.9.4.3 and Magento prior to 1.14.4.3, an authenticated user with limited administrative privileges can inject arbitrary JavaScript code via import / export functionality when creating profile action XML.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8227
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211209030216/https://magento.com/security/patches/supee-11219
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j49x-jjmj-9fqj

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition RCE Vulnerability
entry.content:
In Magento prior to 1.9.4.3, Magento prior to 1.14.4.3, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, and Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1, an authenticated user with administrative privileges for the import feature can execute arbitrary code through a race condition that allows webserver configuration file modification.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8232
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211209030216/https://magento.com/security/patches/supee-11219
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6vc8-3xf2-qrxx

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition RCE Vulnerability
entry.content:
In Magento prior to 1.9.4.3, Magento prior to 1.14.4.3, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, and Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1, an authenticated user with administrative privileges for the import feature can execute arbitrary code through a race condition that allows webserver configuration file modification.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8232
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211209030216/https://magento.com/security/patches/supee-11219
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6vc8-3xf2-qrxx

entry.title: [silverstripe-australia/advancedreports] silverstripe-advancedreports vulnerable to XSS
entry.content:
silverstripe-advancedreports (aka the Advanced Reports module for SilverStripe) 1.0 through 2.0 is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) because it is possible to inject and store malicious JavaScript code. The affects admin/advanced-reports/DataObjectReport/EditForm/field/DataObjectReport/item (aka report preview) when an SVG document is provided in the Description parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-25102
  • https://gist.github.com/ahpaleus/c3bd2d41d306544ca3158569335d12f2
  • https://github.com/nyeholt/silverstripe-advancedreports/releases
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8f2x-hv9r-mh9r

entry.title: [directmailteam/direct-mail] direct_mail for Typo3 sensitive data exposure
entry.content:
The direct_mail (aka Direct Mail) extension through 5.2.2 for TYPO3 has a missing access check in the backend module, allowing a user (with restricted permissions to the fe_users table) to view and export data of frontend users who are subscribed to a newsletter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16698
  • https://extensions.typo3.org/extension/direct_mail
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2019-016/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j2w4-45qm-r674

entry.title: [sfroemken/url_redirect] url_redirect for Typo3 SQLi Vulnerability
entry.content:
The url_redirect (aka URL redirect) extension through 1.2.1 for TYPO3 fails to properly sanitize user input and is susceptible to SQL Injection.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16682
  • https://extensions.typo3.org/extension/url_redirect/
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2019-015/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hcpv-xh8q-f3vq

entry.title: [sjbr/sr-freecap] sr_freecap for Typo3 RCE Vulnerability
entry.content:
The sr_freecap (aka freeCap CAPTCHA) extension 2.4.5 and below and 2.5.2 and below for TYPO3 fails to sanitize user input, which allows execution of arbitrary Extbase actions, resulting in Remote Code Execution.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-16699
  • https://extensions.typo3.org/extension/sr_freecap
  • https://typo3.org/security/advisory/typo3-ext-sa-2019-018/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-598p-rv6p-g7qc

entry.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP and CRM HTML Injection
entry.content:
There is HTML Injection in the Note field in Dolibarr ERP/CRM 10.0.2 via user/note.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-17223
  • https://medium.com/@k43p/cve-2019-17223-stored-html-injection-dolibarr-crm-erp-ad1e064d0ca5
  • https://github.com/Dolibarr/dolibarr/commit/c7736dde41826ac6eca3e838e57eab2f0304e256
  • https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PHP-DOLIBARRDOLIBARR-473217
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3264-65pg-5xm4

entry.title: [pimcore/pimcore] Pimcore XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
Pimcore 6.2.3 has XSS in the translations grid because bundles/AdminBundle/Resources/public/js/pimcore/settings/translations.js mishandles certain HTML elements.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-18656
  • https://github.com/pimcore/pimcore/commit/ca036e9f86bb5cdb3dac0930ec131e5f35e26c5f
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-65p8-5423-fw3x

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XML Injection
entry.content:
An XPath entity injection vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An attacker can craft a GET request to page cache block rendering module that gets passed to XML data processing engine without validation. The crafted key/value GET request data allows an attacker to limited access to underlying XML data.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8158
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051105/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8p5c-f836-m4h7

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XML Injection
entry.content:
An XPath entity injection vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An attacker can craft a GET request to page cache block rendering module that gets passed to XML data processing engine without validation. The crafted key/value GET request data allows an attacker to limited access to underlying XML data.

References

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in in Magento 1 prior to 1.9.4.3 and 1.14.4.3, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with access to the wysiwyg editor can abuse the blockDirective() function and inject malicious javascript in the cache of the admin dashboard.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8152
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211209030216/https://magento.com/security/patches/supee-11219
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jjmg-xmq2-g6ff

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in in Magento 1 prior to 1.9.4.3 and 1.14.4.3, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user with access to the wysiwyg editor can abuse the blockDirective() function and inject malicious javascript in the cache of the admin dashboard.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8152
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211209030216/https://magento.com/security/patches/supee-11219
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jjmg-xmq2-g6ff

entry.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability
entry.content:
A stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.10, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.3 or 2.3.2-p1. An authenticated user can inject arbitrary JavaScript code via customer attribute label.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-8147
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121051105/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.3-and-2.2.10-security-update
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v8fg-p27h-mxjp
